page.title: 05FARMING:FARM STUDY N.STOKE
page.content: To appreciate{farming}a farm study is a good method.North Stoke,Sheepcot and Black Barn farms have been combined as one unit.The total farmed area is 385 hectares.The land is used as follows: units hectares,164 winter wheat,80 winter barley,58 spring barley,24 peas ,10 spring wheat,8 fallow,36 grassland. Livestock consists of:260 breeding ewes ,500 lambs,580 breeding sows and 4500 pigs.Machinery consists of 2 combine harvesters,8 tractors(100 HP) and 4(80 HP).Fodder is stored:2500 tons of corn and 25000 bales of straw.The farm is worked by 2 working partners,4 pigmen, 3students,1 maintenance man,1 odd job man and4 tractor drivers.The poor chalk soils are made fertile by heavy applications of manure and straw.Farming is much influenced by the EEC.
